Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Intrathecal Hydromorphone and TAP Block for Postoperative Analgesia in Upper Abdominal Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: This retrospective study was conducted at West China Hospital, Sichuan University

Participants.evidence: patients aged 18-75 years undergoing elective upper abdominal surgeries between January and June 2023

Intervention.evidence: Participants received either ITH or TAP block

Objective.evidence: This study compares the analgesic efficacy of intrathecal hydromorphone (ITH) and transversus abdominis plane (TAP) block

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of moderate-to-severe pain during movement at 24 hours postoperatively

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 182 patients were analyzed after matching, with 91 in each group

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 182 patients were analyzed after matching, with 91 in each group

Result_Outcome.evidence: The ITH group had a lower incidence of moderate-to-severe pain during movement at 24 hours (27.5% vs. 44.0%; p = 0.02)

Harms.evidence: Pruritus was more frequent in the ITH group (29.7% vs. 6.6%; p < 0.001)
